pr_title: Create a labelset with an arbitrary number of key/value pairs

timeline.bodyText: Consider to remove the other versions for the moment?
timeline.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText:
I'm ok with that if everyone else is. It's definitely a simpler API to have only one method. We can add more over time if people ask for it. The only consideration is the no-op case, where we'd now be forcing people to create an extra Map which will then be thrown away.
What about having this one, plus a varargs version that requires key-value pairs of arguments, which should cover all possible cases, and let the no-op case not require creation of extra garbage when it's not needed?
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: varargs version creates an extra array as well. Can you show me a short code how you want the varargs version that requires key-value pairs of arguments?
replies.author: bogdandrutu
jkwatson

replies.bodyText: note: this would be way simpler with java 8 streams.  ;)
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: I think I like that. Does anybody have experience with varargs API? Are there any pros/cons that we should consider?
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: The big thing to watch out for is that you really need to make sure you don't try to mix varargs and lists in overloaded methods. Other than that, it's very easy to use, assuming its well documented. I'd love other opinions, though!
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: as a note, if we have a varargs based creator, we can get rid of the emptyLabelSet method on the API, since we get that for free with the empty varargs call.
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: I think you can make the change for the moment until we wait for feedback.
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: ok, I'll put in varargs and we can see how it looks
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: belay that. I'll do varargs as a followup PR
replies.author: jkwatson

timeline.message: add a method to create a labelset with an arbitrary number of labels.

timeline.bodyText: We don't use Nonnull anywhere else, probably just remove it for the moment.
timeline.author: bogdandrutu
